newsitem.title: USA: Sallie Mae dissidents claim victory in vote.
newsitem.headline: Sallie Mae dissidents claim victory in vote.

text.p: A dissident shareholder group claimed victory in a vote by Student Loan Marketing Association shareholders over control of the company and privatization.
While voting was still continuing, Albert Lord, the chief executive officer proposed by the dissident Committee to Restore Value (CRV), said his group had won the vote.
"The good news is it's over," Lord told shareholders.
Under Lord, CRV plans to expand the company's student loan operations by originating loans and competing directly with other lenders.
Sallie Mae purchases student loans from banks, keeping some in its portfolio and securitizing others for sale to investors.
